net.pandoragames.far.ui.model

Class TargetFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.pandoragames.far.ui.model.TargetFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, MessageBox

    public class TargetFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageBox, java.lang.Cloneable
    Data container for the files in a result list. Files in that list may have errors, be subject to name changes and selection or be excluded from a subset.
    Author:
    Olivier Wehner at 26.02.2008

      • getDeclaredCharacterset

        public java.nio.charset.Charset getDeclaredCharacterset()
        Returns the character set of this file, if any was specified. Returns null if the default character set should be used.
        Returns:
        character set or null

      • getCharacterset

        public java.nio.charset.Charset getCharacterset()
        Returns the character set that should be used to read this file. If this file has been associated with a particular character set, that one is returned. Otherwise, if this file is of a specific mime type, the character set for that mime type is returned. Otherwise the default character set for TEXT or BINARY files is returned, depending on the value of the flag FileType.TREAT_UNKNOWN_AS_BINARY.
        Returns:
        character set that should be used to read this file, never null

      • setCharacterset

        public void setCharacterset(java.nio.charset.Charset charaset)
        Specifies a character set for this file.

      • isCharsetDefined

        public boolean isCharsetDefined()
        Returns true if the character set associate with this file is specifically defined for this file. Returns false if this file uses the default character set or the characterset of its mime type.
        Returns:
        true if associated character set is defined on this file

      • getMimeType

        public MimeType getMimeType()
        Returns the mime type of this file if defined. Mime type are usually assigned via lookup of the file name extension in the mime registry.
        Returns:
        MimeType or null if unefined

      • isBinaryFile

        public boolean isBinaryFile()
        Returns true if this TargetFile has an assigned mime type that represents a binary file type, or if the it has no assigned mime type at all and the flag FileType.TREAT_UNKNOWN_AS_BINARY is true.
        Returns:
        true if this TargetFile is a binary file (or should be treated as one)

      • getFileExtension

        public java.lang.String getFileExtension()
        Returns the fileExtension as a non null String, separating dot included.
        Returns:
        file extension with leading dot or empty string

      • hasExtension

        public boolean hasExtension()
        Returns true if the the underlying file object has an extension.
        Returns:
        true if file name with extension.

      • setMimeType

        public void setMimeType(MimeType mimeType)
        Explicitely sets a mime type for this file. This overrides the definitions in the mime registry.
        Parameters:
        mimeType - mime type
